channel.title: Comments on: Bill Thompson on the dangers of WiFi hype in the Developing World
channel.description: I am multiple and various - Tomas A. Krag

item.title: By: s woodside
item.dc:creator: s woodside
item.description:
phooey. Wi-Fi isn't deregulation. it's regulation. Although, I seem to be the only one saying that :-
simon
item.content:encoded:
phooey. Wi-Fi isn’t deregulation. it’s regulation. Although, I seem to be the only one saying that :-

simon

item.title: By: m u l · t i · p l i c · i · t y
item.dc:creator: m u l · t i · p l i c · i · t y
item.description:
<strong>WiFi Hype - continued</strong>
Yesterday, I wrote this item about an article on BBC's news site relating to WiFi hype in a developing world context. Simon Woodside commented on my post, noting that Open Spectrum is NOT deregulation as such, but mere RE-regulation....
item.content:encoded:
WiFi Hype – continued

Yesterday, I wrote this item about an article on BBC’s news site relating to WiFi hype in a developing world context. Simon Woodside commented on my post, noting that Open Spectrum is NOT deregulation as such, but mere RE-regulation….
